q_en: What is the production progress of the Dress ordered by Emily? Please represent it in percentage.

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'Emily';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "Emily"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '3';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for orders placed by the customer "Emily"

steps.sql: SELECT p.id FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE pt.description = 'Dress';
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs for products of type "Dress"

steps.sql: SELECT op.id, op.number FROM order_product op WHERE op.order_id IN ('3', '11') AND op.product_id IN ('5', '13', '21', '29');
steps.description: Retrieve the order product IDs and quantities for the products of type "Dress" in orders placed by "Emily"

steps.sql: SELECT st.order_product_id, SUM(st.completed_number) AS completed_quantity FROM sewing_tasks st WHERE st.order_product_id IN ('11', '12', '13', '14') GROUP BY st.order_product_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the completed quantities of sewing tasks for the order products of type "Dress"

steps.sql: SELECT SUM(completed_quantity) AS total_completed, SUM(number) AS total_ordered FROM (SELECT op.id, op.number, COALESCE(st.completed_quantity, 0) AS completed_quantity FROM order_product op LEFT JOIN (SELECT st.order_product_id, SUM(st.completed_number) AS completed_quantity FROM sewing_tasks st WHERE st.order_product_id IN ('11', '12', '13', '14') GROUP BY st.order_product_id) st ON op.id = st.order_product_id WHERE op.id IN ('11', '12', '13', '14')) AS subquery;
steps.description: Calculate the total completed quantity and total ordered quantity for the products of type "Dress" ordered by "Emily"

steps.sql: SELECT (total_completed / total_ordered) * 100 AS production_progress_percentage FROM (SELECT SUM(completed_quantity) AS total_completed, SUM(number) AS total_ordered FROM (SELECT op.id, op.number, COALESCE(st.completed_quantity, 0) AS completed_quantity FROM order_product op LEFT JOIN (SELECT st.order_product_id, SUM(st.completed_number) AS completed_quantity FROM sewing_tasks st WHERE st.order_product_id IN ('11', '12', '13', '14') GROUP BY st.order_product_id) st ON op.id = st.order_product_id WHERE op.id IN ('11', '12', '13', '14')) AS subquery) AS final_query;

response:
Hello there! üòÑ Let's take a look at the production progress for the dresses ordered by Emily. Here's a breakdown of the progress in percentage:

| **Total Ordered** | **Total Completed** | **Production Progress (%)** |
|-------------------|---------------------|-----------------------------|
| 540               | 460                 | 85.19%                      |

So, the production progress for Emily's dress order is approximately **85.19%**. Keep up the great work! üéâ
